Heat rash is uncomfortable, but usually harmless. It usually gets better on its own after a few days.

sections.title: Check if you have heat rash
paragraphs: The symptoms of heat rash are:
The rash looks red on white skin. It may be harder to see or look grey or white on brown or black skin.
The symptoms of heat rash are often the same in adults and children.
It can appear anywhere on the body and spread, but it cannot be passed on to other people.

sections.title: If you're not sure if your child has heat rash
paragraphs: Look at otherrashes in babies and children.

sections.title: How you can treat heat rash yourself
paragraphs: If you have heat rash the main thing to do is keep your skin cool so you do not sweat and irritate the rash.

sections.title: A pharmacist can help with heat rash
paragraphs: Speak to a pharmacist about heat rash. They can give advice and suggest the best treatment to use.

sections.title: Causes of heat rash
paragraphs: Heat rash is usually caused by sweating a lot.
Sweat glands get blocked and the trapped sweat leads to a rash developing a few days later.
Babies often get heat rash because they cannot control their temperature as well as adults and children can.
